definitions.text: the quality of a person's voice
examples: he began in a conversational tone
he spoke in a nervous tone of voice

definitions.text: (linguistics) a pitch or change in pitch of the voice that serves to distinguish words in tonal languages
examples: the Beijing dialect uses four tones

definitions.text: (music) the distinctive property of a complex sound (a voice or noise or musical sound)
examples: the timbre of her soprano was rich and lovely
the muffled tones of the broken bell summoned them to meet

definitions.text: the general atmosphere of a place or situation and the effect that it has on people
examples: the feel of the city excited him
a clergyman improved the tone of the meeting
it had the smell of treason

definitions.text: a quality of a given color that differs slightly from another color
examples: after several trials he mixed the shade of pink that she wanted

definitions.text: a notation representing the pitch and duration of a musical sound
examples: the singer held the note too long
they tested his hearing with pure tones of different frequencies

definitions.text: the elastic tension of living muscles, arteries, etc. that facilitate response to stimuli
a musical interval of two semitones
the quality of something (an act or a piece of writing) that reveals the attitudes and presuppositions of the author
examples: the general tone of articles appearing in the newspapers is that the government should withdraw
from the tone of her behavior I gathered that I had outstayed my welcome

definitions.text: utter monotonously and repetitively and rhythmically
examples: The students chanted the same slogan over and over again

definitions.text: vary the pitch of one's speech
change the color or tone of
